00011 class ORCompoundDataProcessor : public ORUtilityProcessor
00012 {
00013   public:
00014     ORCompoundDataProcessor();
00015     virtual ~ORCompoundDataProcessor() {}
00016 
00017     virtual void SetDataId();
00018     virtual void SetDecoderDictionary();
00019 
00020     virtual EReturnCode StartProcessing(); 
00021     virtual EReturnCode StartRun();
00022     virtual EReturnCode ProcessDataRecord(UInt_t* record);
00023     virtual EReturnCode EndRun();
00024     virtual EReturnCode EndProcessing();
00025 
00026     virtual EReturnCode ProcessMyDataRecord(UInt_t* record);
00027     virtual void SetDoProcessRun();
00028 
00029     // An ORCompoundDataProcessor running concurrently with other
00030     // independent analyses under a larger super-compound processor
00031     // should not return kBreak so that the other compound processors
00032     // can continue to run. So by default, when a component breaks the
00033     // processing of an analysis/run/data record, the
00034     // ORCompoundDataProcessor returns kFailure.  However, for nested 
00035     // ORCompoundDataProcessors, the break condition may still be desired.
00036     // the ability to set/change either behavior is provided by the
00037     // following functions
00038     virtual void SetComponentBreakReturnsFailure() { fBreakRetCode = kFailure; }
00039     virtual void SetComponentBreakReturnsBreak() { fBreakRetCode = kBreak; }
00040 
00041     virtual void AddProcessor(ORDataProcessor* processor);
00042     virtual void ClearProcessors() { fDataProcessors.clear(); }
00043     virtual void RemoveProcessor(ORDataProcessor* processor);
00044 
00045   protected:
00046     virtual void SetRunContext(ORRunContext* aContext);
00047     std::vector<ORDataProcessor*> fDataProcessors;
00048     EReturnCode fBreakRetCode;
00049 };
00050 
00051 #endif
